newsArray.title: "Right up there": SA captain Wolvaardt ranks her memorable 169; reveals wasn't sure about 320-run target
newsArray.description: Guwahati (Assam) [India], October 30 (ANI): South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt described her flamboyant 169 as 'unreal', a performance that came straight out of a kid's dream to score a ton in the showpiece tournament following their Women's World Cup semi-final 125-run win over England at the Barsapara Cricket Stadium. Wolvaardt delivered a statement with her bat, walloping 169 off 143 deliveries, laced with

newsArray.title: Wolvaardt and Kapp power Proteas to maiden Women’s Cricket World Cup final
creator: Keanan Hemmonsbey
newsArray.description: South Africa, 319 for 7 (Laura Wolvaardt 169, Sophie Ecclestone 4-44), beat England, 194 (Nat Sciver-Brunt 64, Alice Capsey 50, Marizanne Kapp 5-20), by 125 runs.The post Wolvaardt and Kapp power Proteas to maiden Women’s Cricket World Cup final appeared first on Daily Maverick.

newsArray.title: Women's WC: Wolvaardt's 169, Kapp's fifer crush England in semi
creator: Asianet News Central
newsArray.description: Laura Wolvaardt smashed a 'dream' 169 as South Africa posted 319/7 in the Women's World Cup semi-final. Marizanne Kapp starred with bat (42) and ball (5/20) to bundle England out for 194, securing a 125-run win and a place in the final.

newsArray.title: First Australia-India Twenty20 washed out by Canberra rain
creator: Ceylon Today
newsArray.description: The first Twenty20 between Australia and India was washed out by the Canberra rain on Wednesday with the tourists able to bat for less than half of their allocated tally of overs for a total of 97 for one. Shubman Gill was 37 not out and skipper Suryakumar Yadav unbeaten on 39 when the first [...]The post First Australia-India Twenty20 washed out by Canberra rain appeared first on Ceylon Today.

newsArray.title: Debarawewa NS advance to the semi-final
creator: Ceylon Today
newsArray.description: Debarawewa National School advanced to the semi-final of the Under 19 Division 3 Tier ‘A’ Inter Schools Limited Overs Cricket Tournament yesterday when they beat Siddhartha MMV Balapitiya by 3 wickets in the quarterfinal played in Debarawewa. Siddhartha MMV: 95 (32.1) (Kavinu Perera 22, Didula Nethsara 3/6, Mirash Rayan 2/12, Chenula Minlaka 2/12) Debarawewa NS: 96/7 (30) [...]The post Debarawewa NS advance to the semi-final appeared first on Ceylon Today.

newsArray.title: Sri Sumangala Hikkaduwa enters final
creator: Ceylon Today
newsArray.description: Sri Sumangala Central College Hikkaduwa entered the final of the Under-19 Division Two Tier ‘B’ limited Overs Inter Schools Cricket Tournament 2025 yesterday when they beat Christ King College Ja-Ela in the semi-final at Surrey Grounds Maggona. Sri Sumangala: 126 (23.5) (Pavani Nirukshan 36, Kaushalya Saranga 34, Rashen Sashika 5/47, Chanidu Weunsara 4/21) Christ King: 72 (23.2) (Latheendra Akash 4/20, [...]The post Sri Sumangala Hikkaduwa enters final appeared first on Ceylon Today.
